meanings.definition: Excessive closeness or intimacy in behavior or attitude.
meanings.sent1: The overfamiliarity of the new student made everyone uncomfortable.
meanings.sent2: His overfamiliarity with the teacher led to a lack of respect.
meanings.sent3: The overfamiliarity of the dog with the mailman resulted in a comical chase around the yard.
meanings.sent4: The overfamiliarity of the politician with the media was like a shadow that followed him everywhere.
meanings.sent5: The overfamiliarity of the toddler with strangers was both endearing and concerning.

meanings.definition: The state of being too familiar or informal.
meanings.sent1: She felt uncomfortable with the overfamiliarity of her coworker.
meanings.sent2: The overfamiliarity of the salesman made the customers uneasy.
meanings.sent3: The overfamiliarity of the robot's voice in the automated messages added a touch of humor to the situation.
meanings.sent4: The overfamiliarity of the old house with the surrounding trees gave it a cozy, nestled appearance.
meanings.sent5: The overfamiliarity of the book character with the readers made the story feel more engaging.
